Description:
Improvement Notice served,

You have failed to ensure that the exposure of your employees to substances hazardous to health, namely mild and stainless steel welding fume, which is a known carcinogen and cause of occupational asthma, is either prevented or, where this is not reasonably practicable, adequately controlled.

Improvement Notice served,

You have failed to ensure that where employees have been provided with tight-fitting respiratory protective equipment to control their exposure to substances hazardous to health, such as welding fume, they have been face-fit tested by a competent person to ensure the equipment is suitable to prevent their exposure.

Improvement Notice served,

You have failed to ensure that workers liable to be exposed to substances hazardous to health, namely metalworking fluid (a cause of dermatitis) and stainless steel welding fume (a respiratory sensitiser) are under suitable health surveillance.


Improvement Notice served,

You have failed to ensure that lifting accessories, namely lifting slings, have been thoroughly examined by a competent person in the last 6 months to ensure that health and safety conditions are maintained and that any deterioration is detected and remedied in good time.

Improvement Notice served,

You have failed to ensure that the guard on the punching station of the Kingsland 75XS combination metalworker is not easily bypassed or disabled so as to prevent access to the dangerous part of the machine, namely the trapping point between the punch and the bed of the machine.
